ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Recurrent Cholesteatoma
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of cholesteatoma removal, recent hearing decrease, drainage, and pain.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Recurrent Cerebrospinal Fluid (CSF) Leak
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of CSF leak repair and reported drainage (otorrhea).

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Mixed Hearing Loss (Left Ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Audiometric evidence of air-bone gap with sensorineural component, consistent with post-surgical status.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sensorineural Hearing Loss (Right Ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Slight to mild SNHL observed on audiogram, though patient is asymptomatic in this ear.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing sensitivity and type of loss given patient complaints.
To assess speech understanding and validate pure-tone thresholds.
To evaluate middle ear status, especially given history of surgery and drainage.
To assess retrocochlear pathway and middle ear function.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with a mixed hearing loss in the left ear and a slight to mild sensorineural loss in the right ear. Speech recognition is excellent bilaterally. Tympanometry in the left ear reveals a large ear canal volume consistent with the mastoidectomy cavity or perforation, while the right ear is normal. Acoustic reflexes are absent bilaterally.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Flat slight to mild SNHL (250-8000 Hz). Left ear: Moderately severe rising to moderate mixed loss (250-2000 Hz), sloping to moderately severe (3000-8000 Hz).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT: Right 25 dB HL, Left 52 dB HL. WRS: 100% bilaterally at suprathreshold levels.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right: Normal (Type A). Left: Flat (Type B) with large ear canal volume (5.9 mL).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Absent ipsilateral and contralateral reflexes from 500 to 4000 Hz bilaterally.

proposed_items: MRI to determine presence of cholesteatoma or new cerebrospinal fluid leak
counseling_actions: Discuss audiometric findings of mixed hearing loss in the left ear and slight loss in the right.
Explain that the large ear canal volume in the left ear is consistent with previous surgery.
Advise on the need for immediate medical follow-up due to symptoms of drainage, pain, and hearing change.

red_flags_present: History of cholesteatoma and CSF leak

escalation.rationale_short: To rule out recurrence of cholesteatoma or new CSF leak given active drainage and pain.

follow_up_plan.objective: Medical evaluation and management of potential recurrence.
